We have a video update to share today from Superintendent Mr. Porter regarding the latest information surrounding the COVID-19 school buildings closure, remote learning and more.

This update includes news of an adjustment to our remote learning plan: Flexible Fridays. Beginning next week (the week of April 20), for the remainder of remote learning, we have asked teachers to think of assignments in terms of a four-day work-week timeframe. Flexible Fridays will be for catching up on work if needed or, simply, enjoying family time.

At the elementary level, this means teachers will not give assignments on Fridays. At the middle and high school levels, teachers will give the entire week’s assignments on Mondays by 9:00 a.m. The work would be due on Fridays, but students have flexibility for when they complete it throughout the week.

Thank you for your continued support.

In This Together, Mentor!
For a city of our size, we have always been heartened by the sense of community that our residents possess. We consistently come together during difficult times to lift each other’s spirits and judging by what we see around town and on social media, this time is no different.

You have been supportive of our safety forces, businesses, and schools... and we are thankful!

Today, Monday, April 13, 2020, the City of Mentor is asking our residents to display that community spirit by creating and sharing your inspirational messages in your windows, doors, and sidewalks.

So grab those crayons, markers, chalk, and posterboard, and let’s show Ohio what Mentor is all about. And, how we face a crisis….together.

Be sure to share your art online with the hashtags #InThisTogetherMentor #InThisTogetherOhio

Starting Monday, we will move to Monday and Wednesday meal pickup from 9-11 a.m. rather than five days a week. We will still provide the same amount of food per breakfast and lunch, but we will pack more meals to be picked up at once. This will be much more convenient for families so they do not have to pick up food every day and it will be safer for our Nutrition Services personnel as well.

To finish out this…

We are hosting NAMI Lake County to share its Ending the Silence for Families presentation on Monday, November 4 at 7:00 p.m. at Memorial Middle School. NAMI is the National Alliance on Mental Illness. Ending the Silence is a free presentation designed to give audience members an opportunity to learn about mental illness through an informative Power Point and short videos. The presentation outlines symptoms of mental health conditions and gives attendees ideas about how to help themselves, friends, or family members who may need support. Additionally, the presentation includes personal testimony from a young adult living with a mental health condition and his/her journey to recovery.

All are welcome to attend. Many of our students have had the opportunity to view this presentation during school time; however, you may still bring your child(ren) at your discretion. The program is not recommended for children under the age of 12.

Please view the attached flyer from NAMI Lake County for more information.

We are deeply saddened to have learned today that Ted Hieronymous has passed away. Mr. Hieronymous served as a music teacher in Mentor Schools for more than 30 years before retiring in 1997. He was able to make a positive impact on the lives of thousands of students over the years - but was probably best known for starting the Mentor Top 25 - our show choir that remains a staple of Mentor High School today - more than 50 years later!

Our thoughts and prayers are with Mr. Hieronymous’ family and friends as they mourn the loss of a loved-one.

We thought you might enjoy reading this article that was in the News Herald a few years ago, as Mr. Hieronymous continued to share his passion for Top 25 with our community. https://www.news-herald.com/news/ohio/mentor-top-will-perform-th-anniversary-big-show-on-april/article_cadca0ec-9e5a-57e5-a563-b0837ca05be6.html
